page.title: 18WOOLAVINGTON OLD VILLAGE
page.content: { The old village of Woolavington }is centred around the church and is located just above the flood level of the moors.Apart from the church the oldest buildings still standing are the{Manor and the Grange.}The houses surrounding thge square are at least 300 years old and are more than likely on the site of the original village.A house survey has shown that the lower half of the village still has 38% of its houses built before 1800,and a further 132 between 1800+1900.There were few houses built between 1900 and 1930.Since 1930 there has been infill of houses which has accounted for 462 of the houses in the old village area.Since 1960 the houses have spread up the hill and 478 houses have been built with planning permission for a further 80 dwellings.{Many old farm {houses have been converted.
